swingtree.animation

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • swingtree.animation.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.lang.Object
    A schedule is used to define when an animation should start and how long it should run.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getDelayIn(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the delay after which the animation should start in the given time unit.
      long getDurationIn(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the duration of the animation in the given time unit.
      long getIterationEndTimeIn(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit, int iteration)
      Returns the end time of the specified iteration in the given time unit.
      long getStartTimeIn(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Returns the time when the animation should start in the given time unit.
      static Schedule of(double time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a new schedule that will start immediately and run for the given duration.
      static Schedule of(double startDelay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit startUnit, double duration, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit durationUnit)
      Creates a new schedule that will start after the given delay and run for the given duration.
      static Schedule of(long time, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Creates a new schedule that will start immediately and run for the given duration.
      static Schedule of(long startDelay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit startUnit, long duration, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit durationUnit)
      Creates a new schedule that will start after the given delay and run for the given duration.

      • getIterationEndTimeIn

        public long getIterationEndTimeIn(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                                  int iteration)
        Returns the end time of the specified iteration in the given time unit. The end time is the time when the animation is scheduled to be finished. This is essentially the start time plus the duration of the animation times the provided iteration number.
        Parameters:
        unit - The time unit in which the end time should be returned.
        iteration - The iteration for which the end time should be determined and returned.
        Returns:
        The end time of the specified iteration in the given time unit.
